features: Keep your Hands Dry and Clean: Using the ratchet in the handle, you can easily twist and wring water out of the string mop head without touching dirty water.
2 Microfiber Twist Mop Head: JEHONN wringer mop is made of premium microfiber, which is super absorbent, easily disassembled and hand-washable. It can catch dust, hair and dirt tightly.
Protective Soft Scrubbing Pad: The soft pad at the wood floor mop head removes stubborn stains without scratching on the ground. Double tail bands and looped ends minimize tangling effectively.
Wide Application: This tornado mop with 57.5Inches (146CM) long handle is great for cleaning bamboo floors, hardwood, ceramic tile, laminate, vinyl, marble, linoleum or any other kinds of floor.

Satisfactory Service: JEHONN has committed to cleaning products for more than 10 years. Quality is guaranteed. If you're not thrilled with our mop twist squeeze, we'd like to offer a prompt full refund. Please rest assured to purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to put together
reviews.reviewText: Well made mop and you get 2 mop heads. I like the big fat hoop on to to hang dry.Love this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great design, lacking some heavy duty
reviews.reviewText: Disclaimer!!! I have no carpet, a big family and a dog so I get some tough and frequent messes. I bought the mop in September and I'm looking into replacement heads now(that I have not found yet.) I love the ratchet wringing and microfiber, without getting your hands wet or dirty you can get the mop very clean and as dry as you'd like for any occasion to include storing almost right away. Sometimes the mop gets hung up when lifting to wring which is expected and the scrubber can wear and cause the head to fall apart (my first mop head). The pole is four pieces and feels like it's going to break with the heavy duty messes but it's holding up minus some rust at the bottom of the pole (don't leave it in water). The manufacturer should consider separate replacement parts and a slightly stronger stitch pattern, but the current one works.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Light weight easy to put together and easy to ring out
reviews.reviewText: I love this mop. Easy to put together light weight easy to ring out and you get an extra head and it is not expensive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Like everyone said….
reviews.reviewText: The handle is flimsy and broke within a short time…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So far no issue. I put it together. Wri is out water very well and is easy to use

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Hand free twist mop
reviews.reviewText: The overall structure and use is quite easy. However, with the mop head being made of synthetic nylon, the quality of “mopping” is not suitable for those purposes. Growing up using a cotton mop head for years, there is a night and day difference. Nylon has a tendency to just “smear around” and not clean as well as anything cotton. Should of just purchased the “old faithful” as I would of better happier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This mop is great. It cleans really well and it is easy to wash.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Needed proper Instructions - PLURAL, was given useless Instruction
reviews.reviewText: Clearly crap with instructions document written by someone who cannot use the language. A red flag was that it was titled "Instruction," singular, not "Instructions," plural! Singular vs. plural is FIRST GRADE ENGLISH! And it was awful from there. It was not clear in how to put it together, and, as a result, the wringer did not work. After about a half hour, I figured out it was assembled wrong due to the poor instructions, but I wasn't about to touch the filthy mop head and try to fix it. Just awful!
